page_description: Analysis of India's real GDP structure and sectoral composition using Gross Value Added (GVA) and Quantum Indices data at constant prices. Highlights sectoral contributions, growth patterns, and a short-term GDP forecast based on Prophet modeling.

charts.title: Sectoral Composition (Share of Total QI, %)
charts.units: Percent of total Quantum Index (volume measure)
charts.description: Displays how agriculture, industry, and services contribute to overall production volume (Quantum Index) over time.
charts.summary: Services consistently dominate India's production structure, accounting for roughly 55–60% of total volume by 2023–24. Industry maintains a steady share near 30%, while agriculture’s share declines gradually toward 10%. The stacked profile indicates long-term structural transformation toward a service-led economy with moderate industrial stability.

charts.title: Sectoral Growth Rates (YoY% change : QI)
charts.description: Year-on-year real growth rates for agriculture, industry, and services based on Quantum Index data.
charts.summary: Growth trends show services as the most stable driver, averaging around 7–8% annually. Industry exhibits larger cyclical swings, with a sharp contraction in 2020–21 and a strong rebound above 10% the following year. Agriculture remains the most volatile, alternating between low positive and near-zero growth. The combined pattern highlights services’ resilience and industry’s sensitivity to shocks.

charts.title: Real GDP Forecast (Prophet, Constant Prices)
charts.description: Prophet model forecast of India's real GDP based on annual constant-price data with 3-year horizon and 80% confidence interval.
charts.summary: The Prophet model tracks actual GDP closely with an average relative error near 3%. It projects continued real GDP expansion through 2026–27 at roughly 6–7% annual growth. The confidence interval widens modestly, indicating stable medium-term predictability. Pandemic disruptions are well-captured as temporary deviations within the overall trend recovery.

overall_insight: Between 2011–12 and 2023–24, India's production structure shows a decisive shift toward services, which now account for over half of real output. Industry remains the second pillar, while agriculture’s contribution continues to shrink in relative terms. Despite short-term volatility, particularly during 2020–21, aggregate production growth has regained its pre-pandemic trajectory. Forecasts suggest sustained medium-term expansion driven primarily by services and recovering industrial momentum.
